name: Matching times in words and analogue clocks

skills.name: Tell the time to half past the hour on an analogue clock
Draw the hands to half past the hour on an analogue clock

explanations.A: You have got the hour correct, but remember the numbers written on the clock don't tell us the minutes. We have to use the little marks, which are one minute each. This minute hand is right at the top so it is zero minutes past the hour. How can we say that?
explanations.B: Remember the shorter hand is the hour hand. Also remember the numbers written on the clock don't tell us the minutes. We have to use the little marks, which are one minute each. This minute hand is right at the top so it is zero minutes past the hour. How can we say that?
explanations.C: Not quite, you have mixed up the minute hand and the hour hand.
explanations.D: The hour hand is pointing to 4, and the minute hand is at the top meaning zero minutes past, so the time is exactly 4 o'clock.

explanations.A: It is 15 minutes past seven, you're right - is there any other way to say this?
explanations.B: It is quarter past seven, you're right - is there any other way to say this?
explanations.C: Not quite, you have mixed up the minute hand and the hour hand.
explanations.D: The hour hand is just after 7, and the minute hand is at the 15th small mark from the top, so the time is 15 minutes past 7 or seven fifteen. 15 minutes = quarter of an hour, so we can also say quarter past 7.

explanations.A: This clock shows three o'clock, but we want half an hour (30 minutes) after 3, so where will the minute hand be?
explanations.B: Almost, but you have mixed up the hour and minute hands.
explanations.C: At half past three the hour hand is halfway between 3 and 4, and the minute hand is halfway around the clock, showing 30 minutes.
explanations.D: The hour hand is almost correct, but the minute hand does not have to be halfway around the clock from the hour hand, it has to be halfway around from the top (12).

explanations.D: The hour hand is almost correct, but the minute hand does not have to be halfway around the clock from the hour hand, it has to be halfway around from the top (12).

explanations.D: Eight ten means ten minutes past 8. The hour hand is just after the 8, and the minute hand is ten minutes around from the top.
